title: Renting a Car Under The Age 25 Can Be An Expensive Endeavor
text:
Renting a Car Under The Age 25 Can Be An Expensive Endeavor Written by: Ellen Chang 08/11/15 - 12:28 PM EDT 
NEW YORK ( MainStreet ) — When Tyler Barnett started his public relations firm in Beverly Hills, Calif. a decade ago, he was only 21, but traveling frequently, which made the task of renting a car agonizing and extremely expensive. 
The major car rental companies would only allow him to rent a car for his business meetings if he paid a higher deposit, he said. Although Barnett said he attempted to explain to them that he was a business owner and needed to conduct presentations for Fortune 500 executives, the rental companies would not budge. In the end, he wound up taking cabs, which was also costly. 
“Even though I was clearly a responsible person, because I was under 25 they could not rent me the car without a ridiculous deposit, even though I was meeting with high profile CEOs,” he said. More Headlines Top Cultural Experiences Being Offered to Travelers in 2015 
Barnett is not alone in his experience, and many Millennials are frustrated by the additional surcharge they incur when they are renting a car under the age of 25. 
“Virtually all rental companies rent to under 25-year old customers, but some do charge surcharges ranging as high as $50 per day,” said Matt DeLorenzo, a managing editor of Kelley Blue Book’s KBB.com, an Irvine, Calif.-based automotive data resource for prices. “They often waive those charges for those who have a corporate renter’s card.” 
Among the major car leasing companies, Enterprise Rent-a-Car, which is based in Clayton, Mo. and owns National and Alamo, charges the same $300 minimum deposit for drivers of any age and does not add on another fee because of age. 
“Anybody who wants to rent a car and is responsible enough to take on that commitment financially should be able to,” said Krista Arthur, a former branch manager and now an account executive for the corporate vanpool division at Enterprise Rent-a-Car in San Diego. “It’s a great option for people if they are going on a trip and want to keep their mileage low, to find out what type of car they want to buy or when their current vehicle is being repaired.” 
The only catch is that drivers under the age of 25 cannot rent pick-up trucks, SUVs or sports cars from Enterprise due to the probability of a higher incidence of accidents and liability. 1
